title: When a dressing room is the stage: Jesse Marsch's Anfield rant proved that a few expletives can enhance a reputation as much as tactics
text:
The most curious aspect of the footage of Wednesday’s half-time talk given by Jesse Marsch, the American coach of Red Bull Salzburg addressing a squad including players from Zambia, Korea, Japan and Brazil as well as a handful of Austrians, is that he seemed to do so in a new language. Hard to pin it down with complete linguistic precision but let’s call it a Germanic-English fusion with a strong strain of Ron Manager: not so much a variety of Esperanto as Exasperatedo.

All in all, a magnificent performance in the away dressing room at Anfield from the former United States international,...
